intro: Castilleja indecora, commonly known as the Indian paintbrush, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant lacks true leaves and relies on its host plants for water and nutrients. It typically grows in open habitats such as grasslands and sagebrush steppe. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it an important species in its native ecosystem.
